version_description:
Apple Watch bug fixes

Improved overall app speed

Map fix for runners in China

Additional bug fixes and stability enhancements

Nike+ Running works with Apple Watch, giving you more ways to get updates on your wrist. To learn more, go to the Apple Watch tab in settings. 

LEADERBOARDS ARE BACK!
See how you stack up against your friends with the new home screen leaderboard preview. The full leaderboard is now just a tap away.

IMPROVED RUN SETUP
It’s now easier to set a goal for each run and receive audio and visual feedback to help you reach your goal.

Fixed a crash when viewing your activity history in Landscape mode
Bug fixes for our Apple Watch runners 
Additional app performance enhancements

LET MUSIC POWER YOUR RUN
Running with your favorite music just got better with the ability to stream Spotify directly within the Nike+ Running app. 

RUN WITH SPOTIFY
As a Nike+ Runner you'll get access to the world's largest music library, Nike+ Run Club Playlists, and a free trial of Spotify Premium. 

INTRODUCING PACE STATIONS
With Spotify Premium, Nike+ Runners get access to our newly launched Pace Station feature. Choose a target pace, a music preference and run to music that will keep you on pace. 

ITUNES ENHANCEMENTS
We've improved the way you can search and select your iTunes music inside the Nike+ Running app.
Bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements.
Bug Fixes

We are Listening

HEADPHONE CONTROLS ARE BACK
Pause your run, control music playback, and adjust volume levels using your headphone remote.

We are Listening

HEADPHONE CONTROLS ARE BACK
Pause your run, control music playback, and adjust volume levels using your headphone remote.

Bug fixes related to playing external podcasts and other music apps.
Now when you receive in-run updates on how far and how fast you’ve run, your music will play as expected.

- We now have an option for using default height and weight settings in Profile set up for runners who do not want to use their true height and weight. 
- Ensure your running data is saved on nikeplus.com by logging into the app.

Thanks for continuing to run with us and giving us positive reviews. Your feedback is important to us. You can always contact our support team through the app or on Twitter @NikeSupport for one-to-one service and feature requests.  

This update includes several bug fixes and app enhancements:
- We fixed an app crash that was occurring on launch for some runners on iPhone 6 and 6s 
- We also fixed a few small bugs for runners who are listening to Spotify on their runs

Welcome to Nike+ Run Club
The Nike+ Running app is now the Nike+ Run Club app with a fresh, new & improved look.
- Coaching plans now adapt to your schedule and progress.
- More fun and personal post-run sharing than ever.
- Compare and compete with your friends by hash-tagging runs.
- Leave your phone at home and run free with Apple Watch.

What’s New in 5.0.1
- We’ve heard your feedback and we’ve brought all of your shoe tags back. You can now view your shoe tag history for all of your past runs in activity history
- Login and registration optimizations when using a Nike+ account or Facebook
- New coaching plans are personalized to you and adapt to your progress. For those who were mid-training you can access your existing plan recommendations at http://nike.com/nrc
 
What’s New in 5.0.0
Welcome to Nike+ Run Club
The Nike+ Running app is now the Nike+ Run Club app with a fresh, new & improved look.
- Coaching plans now adapt to your schedule and progress.
- More fun and personal post-run sharing than ever.
- Compare and compete with your friends by hash-tagging runs.
 
Your feedback is important to us.
We would love to hear from you.
For support, please contact us at: http://nikeplus.com/support

What’s New in 5.0.2
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
- We’ve heard your feedback and we’ve brought all of your shoe tags back. You can now view your shoe tag history for all of your past runs in activity history
- Login and registration optimizations when using a Nike+ account or Facebook
- New coaching plans are personalized to you and adapt to your progress. For those who were mid-training you can access your existing plan recommendations at http://nike.com/nrc
 
What’s New in 5.0.0
Welcome to Nike+ Run Club
The Nike+ Running app is now the Nike+ Run Club app with a fresh, new & improved look.
- Coaching plans now adapt to your schedule and progress.
- More fun and personal post-run sharing than ever.
- Compare and compete with your friends by hash-tagging runs.
 
Your feedback is important to us.
We would love to hear from you.
For support, please contact us at: http://nikeplus.com/support

We’re listening to your feedback and working towards making a great running experience for every one of our athletes. Thank you for your support.

What's New in 5.0.3
- Legacy Coach programs viewable in app
- Notes are back! View & edit run notes
- Playlist shuffle option more visible
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
- Start runs using 3D Touch
- Tap to rotate your metrics in run

You’ve let us know how dedicated you are to finishing your Nike+ Running Coaching plans. If you have an in-progress coaching program you’d like to continue, visit the “My Coach” tab in the app and tap the link to view your previous plan.

What’s New in 5.0.2
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
- We’ve heard your feedback and we’ve brought all of your shoe tags back. You can now view your shoe tag history for all of your past runs in activity history
- Login and registration optimizations when using a Nike+ account or Facebook
- New coaching plans are personalized to you and adapt to your progress.
 
Your feedback is important to us.
We would love to hear from you.
For support, please contact us at: http://nikeplus.com/support

We've resolved a number of bugs to improve your experience.
- Runs stuck in "Sync Pending…" will now sync
- Runs track if you lock your phone during 3-2-1 countdown
- Fix for map routes that were not being drawn fully
- Fix for crash at end of run affecting some users
- Fix for resume button disappearing after pausing run
- App no longer freezes after call or notification
- Average pace now correct for Coach weekly recaps
 
Improvements:
 - Easier to share to Facebook and Instagram
 - Improved support for Voiceover languages
 - Better display after completing a Coach plan
 
New Features for iOS 10:
 - Start, pause and end your run with Siri
 - Send an iMessage with Nike+ Run Club stickers
 
Thank you for your feedback.
Please continue to let us know about any bugs or issues at http://nikeplus.com/support

We've resolved a number of bugs to improve your experience.
- Runs stuck in "Sync Pending…" will now sync
- Runs track if you lock your phone during 3-2-1 countdown
- Fix for map routes that were not being drawn fully
- Fix for crash at end of run affecting some users
- Fix for resume button disappearing after pausing run
- App no longer freezes after call or notification
- Average pace now correct for Coach weekly recaps
 
Improvements:
 - Easier to share to Facebook and Instagram
 - Improved support for Voiceover languages
 - Better display after completing a Coach plan
 
New Features for iOS 10:
 - Start, pause and end your run with Siri
 - Send an iMessage with Nike+ Run Club stickers
 
Thank you for your feedback.
Please continue to let us know about any bugs or issues at http://nikeplus.com/support

We’re listening to your feedback and constantly improving.
- Fix for pause and resume when returning to app
- Fix for run pausing while music buffers
- Runs will now sync to Apple Health app
- Run settings will now be retained after upgrade
- Fixed a bug saving runs ended on Apple Watch
- Fixed a bug checking off Nike+ Coach runs in your plan
- Fixed a bug stopping runs from watch when your phone is locked

Improvements:
- Newly designed run summary screen makes viewing your map and run metrics easier
- Revised post-run sharing flow makes it easier to share to your favorite social networks
- Introducing support for Apple Music. You can now stream your Apple Music as well as the Nike+ Run Club custom playlists directly from the app.

New features for Apple Watch OS3 users:
- Bold display of your running metrics at a glance
- Hear audio readouts right from your watch
- Smart invitations to run, personalized for you
- Schedule run reminders to keep you motivated
- On the Apple Watch Nike+ use Siri to start, Pause, Resume and End your run

Nike+ Run Club takes advantage of the latest Apple Watch features, across all generations of hardware. Apple Watch Series 2 and Apple Watch Nike+ watches will fully track your route using GPS -- whether you run with your phone or not.

Please note: version 5.1 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.

Your feedback is important to us and we would love to hear from you. Please contact us at: http://nikeplus.com/support

Thank you for being a part of the Nike+ Run Club community! We are actively listening to your feedback and working hard to improve your experience.
 
Bug fixes and improvements:
- Improved run activity syncing reliability
- Reduced battery consumption
- Manual run entries now allow a faster min/km pace
- Other bug fixes and performance improvements
 
Please note: version 5.2 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For the
best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.
 
Your feedback is important to us and we would love to hear from you.
Please contact us at: http://nikeplus.com/support

Thank you for being a part of the Nike+ Run Club community! We are actively listening to your feedback and working hard to improve your experience.
 
Bug fixes and improvements for Apple Watch users:
- Split data available in post-run summary on Apple Watch
- Improved GPS/route syncing with runs started on Apple Watch
- For true stand-alone functionality and to save battery life, runs started with Apple Watch will no longer start the Nike+ Run Club app on iPhone
 
Tip: To view heart rate and pace metrics in-run, scroll down to Settings on the Start screen and toggle on ‘All Metrics’
 
General app bug fixes and performance improvements
 
Introducing:
“JUST DO IT.
SUNDAY”
-Join the global community and walk, jog, or run your way to a 5k or more each Sunday.
- Get in-run encouragements from Kevin Hart
- Unlock exclusive stickers to share on your photos
- Complete three consecutive “Just Do It. Sunday” runs to start a streak.
 
Please note: version 5.3 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.
 
For more information on NRC product updates, fixes/improvements, and pro-tips, visit our blog at http://nrc.nike.com

Thank you for being a part of the Nike+ Run Club community! We appreciate all of your feedback and ratings.
 
APPLE WATCH
Bug Fixes and Improvements:
- Improved reliability of heart rate data transfers to phone
- Improved experience when running with your watch and phone. Start a run from your phone and your watch app will automatically start.
- TIP: For running indoors, start the run from your watch, and make sure you have the “indoor” setting toggled to on. The device you start your run on is the primary tracking device.
 
PHONE
Bug Fixes and Improvements:
- Fixed occasional blank activity tab
- Improved shoe tagging functions, including ability to retire a shoe. Swipe to retire your shoes from your Profile or on the post-run summary screen.
- We’ve made it easier to select a goal based run. Choose “Distance” or “Duration” to track a goal based run and receive in-ear feedback as you get closer to your goal. You can also “Speed” to track an interval run workout.
 
Please note: version 5.4 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.
 
For more information on NRC product updates, fixes/improvements and pro-tips, visit our blog at http://nrc.nike.com

Thank you for being a part of the Nike+ Run Club community! We appreciate all of your feedback and ratings.
 
5.4.1
Bug fixes:
- Fixed an app load crash issue affecting some users
- Fixed missing shoe tagging data for some users
 
If you are still experiencing a blank activity history screen, please know that your activities are not lost. We are working to fix this issue, but in the meantime, force quitting and re-opening the app should resolve this issue.
 
5.4
APPLE WATCH
Bug Fixes and Improvements:
- Improved reliability of heart rate data transfers to phone
- Improved experience when running with your watch and phone. Start a run from your phone and your watch app will automatically start.
- TIP: For running indoors, start the run from your watch and make sure you have the 'indoor' setting toggled to on. The device that you start your run on is the primary tracking device.
 
PHONE
Bug Fixes and Improvements:
- Improved shoe tagging functions, including ability to retire a shoe. Swipe to retire your shoes from your Profile or on the post-run summary screen.
- We've made it easier to select a goal-based run. Choose 'Distance' or 'Duration' to track a goal-based run and receive in-ear feedback as you get closer to your goal. You can also choose 'Speed' to track an interval run workout.
 
Please note: version 5.4.1 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.
 
For more information on NRC product updates, fixes/improvements and pro-tips, visit our blog at http://nrc.nike.com

We’ve been busy. Check out our latest improvements:
 
APPLE WATCH
- We’ve improved the calculation of the Current Pace displayed during your run
IMPORTANT: To view Pace while you’re running, please be sure to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity on your iPhone
 
PHONE
- Easier access to view your Personal Records and Run Levels on the Activity screen. Break some records and keep running to reach level Volt
- You can now remove a Shoe from your Shoe list. Access Shoes from your Profile or Run Summary and swipe left to Retire or Edit
- We've added some fun new stickers to share your Just Do It. Sunday runs. Join our global community 5K every Sunday to get access
- Added Average Pace setting to customize your run experience. Check out ‘Run Settings’ on the Start screen and select Average or Current Pace to be displayed during your run. This setting applies to both Phone and Watch
 
Additional bug fixes and enhancements.
 
For more updates and pro-tips, please visit nrc.nike.com

We’ve been busy. Check out our latest improvements:
 
APPLE WATCH
- We’ve improved the calculation of the Current Pace displayed during your run
IMPORTANT: To view Pace while you’re running, please be sure to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity on your iPhone
 
PHONE
- Easier access to view your Personal Records and Run Levels on the Activity screen. Break some records and keep running to reach level Volt
- You can now remove a Shoe from your Shoe list. Access Shoes from your Profile or Run Summary and swipe left to Retire or Edit
- We've added some fun new stickers to share your Just Do It. Sunday runs. Join our global community 5K every Sunday to get access
- Added Average Pace setting to customize your run experience. Check out ‘Run Settings’ on the Start screen and select Average or Current Pace to be displayed during your run. This setting applies to both Phone and Watch
 
Additional bug fixes and enhancements.
 
For more updates and pro-tips, please visit nrc.nike.com

General bug fixes and improvements.
 
Please note: version 5.6 of Nike+ Run Club requires iOS 10. For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.1 or above.
 
For more information on NRC updates and pro-tips, visit our blog at http://nrc.nike.com

We’ve been busy. Check out our latest improvements:
 
APPLE WATCH
- Speed Run has arrived. You can now mark intervals and laps by using the Speed Run feature on your watch
PRO-TIP: Double-tap on the main screen during your run to mark intervals
 
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.2.2 or above.
 
PHONE
- Trophies and Achievement badges are back! Stay motivated and celebrate your accomplishments with brand new achievements.
Collect, celebrate, and share on Nike+ (and anywhere else you want).
- We’ve made it easier to find friends! Check out the improved experience by clicking on the ‘Add Friends’ icon on the Club tab.
 
Additional bug fixes and enhancements.
 
For more updates and pro-tips, please visit nrc.nike.com

We’ve been busy. Check out our latest improvements:
 
PHONE
- Introducing NRC Camera Effects for Facebook. Access Facebook Camera in NRC to share your post-run selfie with fun new effects, including animated headbands and route details. Be sure to save your image and share again on the Nike feed.
- Improved Run Settings. We’ve simplified the way to customize your run experience. Check it out to easily change your display/audio preferences, switch to indoor mode, and more.
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements.
 
APPLE WATCH
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: To see your heart rate during your run, scroll down to Settings on your Watch and turn on ‘All Metrics’.
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 3.2.2 or above.
 
For more updates and pro-tips, please visit nrc.nike.com

We are super excited about this update. We hope you like it.
 
PHONE
- Introducing Audio Guided Runs. Run with Nike’s coaches and athletes in a series of audio guided workouts. Mix up your routine with speed runs with Mo Farah and Kevin Hart. Each run is paired with a playlist so be sure to connect your streaming music account to get the best experience.
- Cheers! Running is more fun when your friends Cheer you on. Notify friends when you go for a run and get Cheers to keep you going. TIP: Turn on this feature in Run Settings>Audio Feedback>Audio Cheers
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements.
 
APPLE WATCH
- Audio Guided Runs are also available on your Watch. Scroll down under the Start button to find them. Please be sure to download the runs to your watch before you head out.
- Cheers! Receive Cheers from your friends on your watch. Swipe left to Settings and turn on Cheers.
- Activity History. You can now see the details of your last 5 runs on your Apple Watch.
- Elevation data will now be available on standalone watch runs (Apple Watch Series 3 only)
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: To see your heart rate during your run, swipe left on your Watch and turn on ‘All Metrics’.
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 4.0 or above.
 
For more updates and pro-tips, please visit nrc.nike.com

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- Support for iPhone X
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
 
PRO-TIP: Check out our new Audio Guided Runs feature and experience a new and exciting way to run with NRC. Train with Nike’s coaches and athletes in a series of audio-based running workouts.
 
APPLE WATCH
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIPS:
- To see your heart rate during your run, swipe left on your Watch and turn on ‘All Metrics’.
- Audio Guided Runs is also available on your Apple Watch. Scroll down below the START button to access them and experience a game-changing way to run.
 
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 4.0.1 or above.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- Improved Just Do It. Sunday achievements. Complete any type of run for at least 1M, 5K or 10K on Sundays to earn the new badges.
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
 
PRO-TIP: Check out our new Audio Guided Runs feature and experience a new and exciting way to run with NRC. Train with Nike’s coaches and athletes in a series of audio-based running workouts.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- Introducing Challenges. Stay motivated and push yourself to run 15K (9 Miles) per week or 50K (31 Miles) per month and see how you stack up against the global community of Nike runners. Exciting new Achievements can be earned with each Challenge. Also keep a look out for occasional special Nike Challenges! Get moving and join one today!
- General bug fixes and enhancements.

PRO-TIP: Check out our new weekly and monthly distance Challenges to stay motivated and keep running.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- Improved functionality for Guided Runs! At the end of each guided run or workout, if you want to continue running, you can now resume the run to have one continuous activity saved. If you do not want to continue running, please be sure to end the run manually. This new functionality also applies for Guided Runs started on Apple Watch.
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: Check out our new weekly and monthly distance Challenges to stay motivated and keep running.
  
APPLE WATCH
- Better navigation design to discover and explore Guided Runs. Swipe left on the main START screen and try a new run!
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 4.2 or above.

Here’s what’s new with this update:

PHONE
- General bug fixes and enhancements.

PRO-TIP: Check out our new weekly and monthly distance Challenges to stay motivated and keep running.

APPLE WATCH
- General bug fixes and enhancements.

PRO-TIPS:
- To see your heart rate during your run, swipe left on your Watch and turn on ‘All Metrics’.

IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.

For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 4.2 or above.

PHONE
- Improved Shoe Tagging experience! We’ve made it easier to find and add new shoes. Track total runs, distance, average pace and time for each pair of shoes you own. Instantly access your shoes before a run on Quickstart. Get reminders as you approach your distance goal for each shoe.
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: Check out our new weekly and monthly distance Challenges to stay motivated and keep running.
  
APPLE WATCH
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 4.3 or above.

Revamped post-run experience. This new release comes with an updated layout, bold metrics, a dynamic map view and advanced pace tables to visualize your run.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- Custom Challenges. Now you can create your own Challenge. Invite your friends, set a goal and crush
it together! Check your progress on the Leaderboard and earn Achievements when you cross the finish line.
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: Track your shoe mileage and see how far you run in each pair. Tap the shoe icon on the top left in Quickstart to get started.
 
APPLE WATCH
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 5.0 or above.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
- NRC now works with Siri Suggestions. Siri can now suggest good times for a run based on your run history. On your iPhone, go to Settings > Siri & Search > Nike Run Club to enable.
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
PRO-TIP: Check out our new weekly and monthly distance Challenges to stay motivated and keep running.
 
APPLE WATCH
- Easily access NRC with new watch complications to use with the Infograph watch faces. Use your Watch app on your iPhone to add and customize.
- General bug fixes and enhancements.
 
IMPORTANT: You need to authorize NRC to access Motion and Fitness Activity in order to track a run.
 
For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using WatchOS 5.0 or above.

Here’s what’s new with this update:
 
PHONE
Improved running functionality!
- Easily view splits and access auto-pause and audio feedback settings during your run.
- Customizable display for metrics that matter most (tap on each to change).
- Lap button for Speed Runs. Mark an interval without pausing the run with a standard Lap button.
- Better integration with Apple Music and Spotify. Seamlessly control music from your existing apps and discover new Nike playlists. Spotify Free accounts are now compatible.
 
APPLE WATCH
- Lap button for Speed Runs. Double tap the screen or use the new Lap button to mark an interval during a Speed Run.
 
 For the best results on Apple Watch, we recommend using watchOS 5.0 or above.
A stand-alone experience. Enjoy all the Apple Watch features without your phone.

A stand-alone experience. Enjoy all the Apple Watch features without your phone.
Your Apple Watch and iPhone should be on the same version of Nike Run Club for the best experience.
Revamped post-run experience. This new release comes with an updated layout, bold metrics, a dynamic map view and advanced pace tables to visualize your run.
Revamped post-run experience. This new release comes with an updated layout, bold metrics, a dynamic map view and advanced pace tables to visualize your run.
Performance improvements and bug fixes.
Performance improvements and bug fixes.

—Updated Quick Start selector lets you set a goal before starting your run 
—Improved user interface for a seamless experience
 —More personalized Challenge leaderboards now show your ranking

—Updated Quick Start selector lets you set a goal before starting your run 
—Improved user interface for a seamless experience
 —More personalized Challenge leaderboards now show your ranking

—Enhanced Run Details: You can now view more post-run metrics in your activity summary, including cadence, fastest mile, and more.

Apple Watch:
—Run Level Color: Your run level color now appears throughout the experience.
—Nike Twilight Mode: Brighten up your in-run screen with your run level color.

—New in-run metrics: You now can view Current Pace and Average Pace at the same time during your run. Tap any metric on your in-run screen to customize it with metrics you care about.
—Ratings for Guided Runs: Now you can share feedback after every Guided Run to help us make them better.
—General bug fixes and improvements.
 
Apple Watch
—Customizable metrics and new layout: Tap any metric on your in-run screen to customize it with metrics you care about. Your Total Run Time is now in the top left corner, so you can see how long you’ve been running at a glance. The progress bar is now more easily visible, so you know how close you are to completing your goal.
—New in-run and post-run metrics: You now can view Current Pace and Average Pace at the same time during your run. Additionally, Calories are now visible during your run and post run.
—Screen Lock: Lock your screen during an active session to prevent accidental taps. Just swipe to the pause screen during a run to enable it, and scroll on the digital crown to disable it.

— Saved Runs: You can now add Guided Runs to your Saved Runs list. Save a run for later or re-run your favorites.
— General bug fixes and improvements.

— Saved Runs: You can now add Guided Runs to your Saved Runs list. Save a run for later or re-run your favorites.
— General bug fixes and improvements.

— Saved Runs: You can now add Guided Runs to your Saved Runs list. Save a run for later or re-run your favorites.
— General bug fixes and improvements.

—The refreshed Start Run brings your run level to life with colored backgrounds.
—Guided Runs are now accessible from the Start Run screen, so you can join Nike coaches and athletes on a run as soon as you open the app.
—Your recently completed Guided Runs are now saved in one location, so you can easily find and repeat them.
—Improved in-run analytics.
A standalone experience. Enjoy all the Apple Watch features without your phone.

—New and enhanced Achievement Locker highlights your latest achievements alongside the first ones you ever earned.
 —With Downloaded Runs, you can now view all your downloaded Guided Runs in one place.
 —Updated push notifications now give you motivational reminders about your next run.
 —Bug fixes and enhancements.

• You can now create custom, individual Challenges to set new goals for yourself.
• General bug fixes and improvements.

•New Apple Watch complications like the Pace Graph and Weekly Streaks give you detailed stats and more motivation at a glance to keep you on track.
•More new and refreshed complications: Start, Total Monthly Miles, Featured Run and Last Run Details.
•Bug fixes and enhancements.

watchOS
•New Apple Watch complications like the Pace Graph and Weekly Streaks give you detailed stats and more motivation at a glance to keep you on track.
•More new and refreshed complications: Start, Total Monthly Miles, Featured Run and Last Run Details.
The completely refreshed Feed gives you Nike coaching, expert wellness advice, and community content, so you can reach your goals and get the most out NRC.

• Refreshed Activity Hub: Now you can easily view and navigate between your weekly, monthly, yearly and all-time stats. With key metrics, faster browsing, and richer activity details, the Activity Hub is the best place to see your progress.
• Bug fixes and enhancements.

New NRC widgets display your personalized run stats on the home screen of your iPhone. Show your colors with the Run Level widget, and see your post-run progress with the Last Run widget. Add the new Quickstart widget to your screen and make it even easier to start your next run.

New NRC widgets display your personalized run stats on the home screen of your iPhone. Show your colors with the Run Level widget, and see your post-run progress with the Last Run widget. Add the new Quickstart widget to your screen and make it even easier to start your next run.

• Updated Challenges: Join new Challenges or create your own, and then invite your NRC friends or share collective goals with the community using easy in-app or text message invites.
• New Run Charts: Visualize more of your stats with Run Charts in the Last Run widget. You can select pace, elevation or heart rate to see the stats of your most recent run on a colorful line chart.

• Updated Challenges: Join new Challenges or create your own, and then invite your NRC friends or share collective goals with the community using easy in-app or text message invites.

* IMPORTANT: We have upcoming improvements for our login process across all Nike apps. Please make sure the email address associated with your Nike Profile is up to date. If it is not up to date, please edit your email address within Settings, or contact Customer Service by tapping 'Contact Us' in Settings.
* Guest Mode (China Only): Now you can try Nike Run Club without creating a Nike account. As a guest, you can join select Guided Runs and preview Member-only app features. Like what you see, or need more motivation? Create a free account to track and save your activities, see lifetime stats and personalized insights, earn badges and more.
